alert.note: Alert for Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washington, Bennington and Windham Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dorset to 7 miles west of Wilmington to Hinsdale. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roadways and in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Brattleboro, Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Stratton, Monroe, Shaftsbury, Pownal, Putney, Vernon, Dorset, Wilmington, Stamford, Readsboro, Newfane, Guilford Center, Manchester Center, West Wardsboro and Porter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
